quiz.text:
Statements:
  1. All of the UK's top 10 warmest years, in the time series from 1884, have occurred this century. The UK’s climate is continuing to change, recent decades have been warmer, wetter and sunnier than the 20th century. While the year 2021 would be considered near normal compared to the last three decades, before 1990, a year like this would be the second warmest in the series.
  2. Over the last few decades, global temperatures have risen sharply — to approximately 0.7℃ higher than our 1961-1990 baseline. When extended back to 1850, we see that temperatures then were a further 0.4℃ colder than they were in our baseline. Overall, this would amount to an average temperature rise of 1.1℃.
options: Statement II is the effect and statement I is the cause
Statement I is the effect and statement II is the cause
Both Statement I and II are the effects of same cause
Both Statement I and II are the causes of same effect
Statement I and statement II are the effects of independent causes

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the PM Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (PMGKAY)?                                                                                                                                                                          

A. Central government will provide free foodgrains to about 81.35 crore beneficiaries under the National Food Security Act (NFSA) for one year from January 1, 2023

B. The new integrated scheme will subsume two current food subsidy schemes of the Department of Food and Public Distribution- a) Food Subsidy to NAFED for NFSA, and b) Food Subsidy for centralized procurement states, dealing with procurement, allocation and delivery of free foodgrains to the states under NFSA.

C. Under the scheme, Government of India will provide free foodgrains to all NFSA beneficiaries i.e., Antyodaya Ann Yojana (AAY) households & Priority Household (PHH) persons.
options: A and C
B and C
Only C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Union Budget 2023-24 has announced the setting up of the Urban Infrastructure Development Fund (UIDF), it will be managed by-
options: Reserve Bank of India
Small Industries Development Bank of India
Industrial Development Bank of India
National Housing Bank
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement/s is/are incorrect with respect to the Employees’ State Insurance (ESI) scheme?

A. Existing wage limit for coverage under scheme is Rs.15,000/- per month (Rs.18,000/- per month in the case of Persons with Disability).

B. State Governments also bear 1/8th share of cost of Medical Benefits.

C. Scheme is financed by contributions from employers and employees.
options: A and B
Only A
Only B
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect to the Post Matric Scholarship for ST students?
options: Students can take admission only in empanelled Institutes within state.
Scheme is for studies in India and abroad.
Student should not be getting any other scholarship.
Scholarship given starting from class XI to graduation in India.
There is no ceiling even for students studying in private sector.

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with respect Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)?                                                                                                                                                                         

A. It has replaced the National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS).

B. Recently (March 2023) National Crop Insurance Portal’s digitized claim settlement module DigiClaim launched under the yojana.

C. Yojana is compulsory for loanee farmers.
options: A and B
B and C
Only C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: What is targeted investment under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Kisan Samridhi Sah-Yojana?
options: INR 5,000 crore
INR 6,000 crore
INR 7,000 crore
INR 8,000 crore
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with reference to the Pradhan Mantri Anusuchit Jati Abhyuday Yojana (PM – AJAY)?

A. The Scheduled Castes persons living below the poverty lines are eligible for getting benefits under the scheme.

B. In case of Infrastructure Development, the villages having 70% or more SC population are eligible for grants under the Scheme.

C. Ministry of Rural Development is the Nodal Ministry of the scheme.
options: A and B only
B and C only
Only C
Only A
A, B and C

quiz.text:
Which of the following statement(s) is/are incorrect with respect to ‘Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana’?

A. The scheme is implemented by Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas.

B. Initially, the scheme targeted to provide 8 crore LPG connections, which was extended to 12 crore.

C. Financial support of Rs. 3000 per LPG connection.
options: Only A
Only B
Only C
A and B
B and C

quiz.text:
Which of the following statements is/are correct with respect to ‘Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana’?

A. Only the BPL ration card will be considered for the purpose of family identification

B. Aadhar card is mandatory for enrolment in all States/Union territories

C. In case of no adult female member available, a joint LPG connection can be issued in the name of eldest male family member along with a minor female member of the house
options: A and B
A and C
B and C
A, B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statement/s is/are correct with reference to the functions of National SC/ST Hub?
options: To encourage SC/ST owned units to achieve share of at least 40% of total procurement being made by Central/State Governments, CPSEs, and other government agencies.
To sensitize, encourage and enable SC/ST owned units for participation in Public Procurement Process.
Facilitating SC/ST Entrepreneurs to be part of vendor development programs and mentoring support.
Only 2 and 3
All 1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Recently (March 2023), Government of India approved setting up of Electronics Manufacturing Cluster under Modified Electronics Manufacturing Cluster Scheme at which location?
options: Telangana (Warangal)
Uttar Pradesh (Lucknow/Hardoi)
Karnataka (Hubli-Dharwad)
Madhya Pradesh (Dhar)
Maharastra (Amrawati)
